content:
Hello everyone,
Could you please clarify how can one specify that :iterate modifier should be supported in the CapabilityStatement and/or SearchParameter definition? Since _include is not a regular search parameter, I don't see an obvious way to do it. Is there some convention about that, or :iterate is always expected to be supported for _include?

is :iterate is always expected to be supported for _include?

nope

@Eric Haas Ok, but how can one understand of it is required or not? I'm looking for a formal/computable way to specify that in CapabilityStatement/SearchParameter, not in a narrative content form. Maybe there is a special extension for that?

_include is a regular search parameter that applies to all resource types.. you can identify which types it applies to in your capabilities and document whether :iterate is supported. using CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.documentation or a custom extension on CapabilityStatement.rest.resource.searchInclude. I think Carin did this...

I don't think the juice is worth the squeeze but you could point to a derived SearchParameter and formally define the conformance requirements there by "SHALLing" the modifier. There is an new capabilityStatement in R5 that allow you to do this more easily

image.png

Yes, actually Carin specified it as a narrative content, and we can't use it in our automated solution to understand the expectation, since it is not an extension or some other pre-defined structure.
The custom extension and the R5 ways sound good. Thank you for your help!
